page.title: 06FARMING IN THE BROUGH AREA
page.content: ALONG THE A66 THE NORTH AND SOUTH SIDES OF THE ROAD ARE DIFFERENT.THIS IS BECAUSE THE NORTH SIDE IS HILLY AND ROUGH GRASS BECAUSE IT IS THE ARMY RANGE,AND THE SOUTH SIDE IS NICE CULTIVATED LAND. IN GREAT MUSGRAVE THERE IS A FIELD WITH LYNCHETS.THEY WERE MADE BY THE PEOPLE IN THE BRONZE AGE LONG BEFORE THE ROMANS CAME AND THEY ARE STILL THERE.THEY WERE BUILT ON A HILLSIDE BECAUSE IN THOSE DAYS THE LOWLAND WAS BOGGY. IN FLITHOLME THERE IS A BUSINESS WHICH SELLS TRACTORS AND OTHER FARM MACHINERY.LAND AROUND FLITHOLME AND MUSGRAVE IS GOOD SHEEP AND CATTLE GRAZING. THERE ARE TWO FARMS IN BROUGH AND THREE FARMS IN CHURCH BROUGH.THE LAND IN THE NORTH UP HILLBECK IS VERY HILLY ESPECIALLY ON THE PENNINE FELLS.
